sentences.sContent: Have you done your homework yet?
You need to do more exercise.
...Anyone interested or intend to inquire about please do not feel hesitated to contact Xiao Li...
...I thought that someone might do something stupid...
...yet I had this strong sense of “I have to do this...
...and that there would be sufficient space to do that...
...noticed a “brown patch” on the back of the car after the owner parked it to do some shopping...

...finds that the best way to ensure employees are “engaged” is to give them more control over where and how they do their work―which may mean liberating them from having to do everything in collaboration with others...
...Most people do not have clear memories of past events...
...please do not hesitate to contact me...
...And there was plenty of opportunity to do whatever you felt like doing...
...watch videos or listen to music and so on with it as morally as you do with a brand-new one...

synos.tran: 要求；规定；C大调音阶中的第一音

phrases.pCn: 服无期徒刑；多才多艺；包办一切
凑合着用；以…权充；设法达成
[口语]兴旺，发达，昌盛，成功；变得富裕起来；改善自己的社会地位
获得大量的…；有很多的…供应，得到…充足的供给
整理；刷新；修缮；使精疲力尽
执政党与在野党；注意事项，行为准则

trans.tranCn: （用于实义动词前构成否定句和疑问句）
trans.tranOther: used before a full verb to form negative sentences and questions
to perform an action or activity
